citations.narrative:
During this inspection, one Red Ruffed lemur was permitted to sit on the heads of at least two members of the public
during the tour conducted by the facility. The inspector observed the lemur being able to sit on the heads of these patrons
during photo opportunities offered by the facility.
Allowing non-human primates to sit on the heads or shoulders of guests heightens the risks of injury to both the animals
and public, and can contribute to greater exposure of zoonotic diseases between non-human primates and humans.
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure safety of animals
and the public.
Correct by July 27, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives and licensee.
